divs: sighting detailssighting report: after last night92s report on 7 news, i felt compelled to finally come forward with a ufo sighting i had while i was in the marine corps. it was either late 1996 or early 1997, my infantry unit was training at the pohakuloa training area. my master sergeant, msgt. tuia typically had a hard time sleeping and would wake me up around 3-4am to drive him around so he could get some extra sleep. one night, i was driving with him asleep in the passenger seat. since it was a training area, i had to drive with an\pvs-7 night vision goggles. on a remote road with no other traffic, i was looking at the night=92s sky and that is when i saw the object. between mauna kea and mauna loa an object appeared and from left to right the object moved at an amazing rate and then stopped, hovered and moved again. the movements that followed were erratic and darted back and forth across the sky. all of the movement took place between the sky visible between the mountains and then took off into the sky, out of sight. i could draw an approximate path of flight. the movements were very exact, i liken it to moving a pointer on a pc. if you move the pointer quickly from left to right and then in various directions all in straight lines. you would see abrupt stops and quick acceleration. the object size in relation to the stars could best be described in the following fashion. if the typical star is about the diameter of a pin, this object was much brighter and would have been about three pins. night vision goggles typically produce light noise. the pixels flash and pop but this object was definitely not a standard in the equipment. i was also very awake when this happened and in fact was quite bored so this took me by surprise. the exclamation point to this event happened right after it happened. after seeing this, i immediately pulled the hummer to the side of the road. i reacted so quickly that it woke msgt. tuia. i was yelling, =93holy s#!@=94 over and over again and got out of my vehicle to look around for the object. msgt. tuia kept asking, =93what in the hell is wrong with you?=94 and without thinking, i told him that i had just seen a ufo. he told me that he saw tons of them when he was in vietnam and to get back in the vehicle and drive. i couldn=92t believe that he was so nonchalant about the event. he acted like it was old news. regardless, i knew what i saw and have never forgotten it.
